result.execSummary:
The defendant Luther Charles Goodman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees by 09-19-2017 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and work search. Cedit for 19 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($75 + $175= $250) gj

Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court ordered Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Bench warrant previously issued remains in effect.
Justice point discharge summary received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT FOR SENTENCING.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant failing to appear to address his violation, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered remand to JUDGE for sentencing.  Case remains calendared for sentencing in Branch 47 on 6/21/2016 at 1:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  
Positive drug test.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 06-02-2016 at 8:30am in Branch 47.

Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Luther Charles Goodman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
